name: Bosnia and Herzegovina / Croatia / Slovenia / Montenegro / Serbia
description: Said after something positive to avoid jinxing it.

name: Brazil
description: Three knocks after mentioning a bad possibility.

name: Portugal
description: Three knocks, no verbalization required.

name: Bulgaria
description: Used to ward off evil; sometimes followed by pulling the earlobe.

name: Czech Republic
description: Knock on wood, glass, teeth, even forehead.

name: Denmark
description: Often with knocking under the table; magic numbers.

name: Egypt
description: Said to keep good luck going and prevent envy.

name: England (UK)
description: Modern British usage; continuity of good luck.

name: Georgia
description: Three knocks when mentioning a bad possibility.

name: Germany
description: Knock three times on wood.

name: Greece / Cyprus
description: Said to prevent a spoken negative from happening.

name: Indonesia / Malaysia / Thailand
description: Knock on wood and sometimes forehead to ward off bad talk.

name: Iran
description: To prevent the evil eye after praising someone/something.

name: Italy
description: Touch iron, especially about death-related bad luck.

name: Catalonia
description: Protection against bad luck.

name: Latin America (general)
description: Touch wood; variant excludes objects with legs.

name: Argentina
description: Also symbolic left-side tapping (gendered).

name: Lebanon / Syria
description: Said after positives or negatives to prevent change.

name: Netherlands
description: Knock on unpainted wood.

name: Norway
description: Knock on the table.

name: Poland
description: Knock on unpainted wood, mostly after negatives.

name: Romania
description: Knock on wood to avoid bad outcomes.

name: Spain
description: Said to keep good situations going.

name: France
description: To continue good luck.

name: Sweden
description: Pepper, pepper, touch wood.

name: Turkey
description: Three knocks, often with earlobe pull, to avert evil eye.

name: United States
description: Modern apotropaic usage; folk rifle story noted.

name: Russia / Ukraine / Estonia
description: Knock on wood; sometimes with spitting sound to left.
